newsitem.title: SPAIN: Santander plans more moves in East Europe.
newsitem.headline: Santander plans more moves in East Europe.

text.p: Spain's Banco de Santander is looking for more business opportunities in Eastern Europe having bought a stake in a private Hungarian bank, a spokesman for the bank said on Wednesday.
Santander is also studying expansion possibilities for its German unit CC-Bank Moenchengladbach in East Germany, as well as in the Czech Republic and Poland, he added.
A month ago Santander bought almost five percent of Hungarian bank Inter-Europa Bank for which it has an option to increase the stake to 9.9 percent before year-end.
"It was a relatively small operation. But we consider it a starting point for opportunities in Eastern Europe," the spokesman said.
Inter-Europa Bank is a high street bank, also licensed for corporate and private clients.
In April Santander increased its stake in CC-Bank to 100 percent from 50 percent, paying 25 billion pesetas.
